title: Force vs time graph for a wheel

content.question: A motor drives a shaft of radius <math alttext="R over 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> that is attached to the center of a wheel of radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The motor is turned off, and the force that the motor exerts on the shaft, <math alttext="F sub motor" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, varies with time, as shown. There is also a constant friction force of <math alttext="0.4 newton" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> applied to the rim of the wheel in the opposite direction of the motion. During which time interval does the rotational kinetic energy increase and then decrease?

choices.label: From <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>s</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 1 second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

From <math alttext="t equals 1 second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

From <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

From <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 7 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

From <math alttext="t equals 7 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 8 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: From <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
